header.title: The Scroll of Set - Issue Number 156, Volume XXIV-2, April 1998
header.category: Western Esotericism, Occultism, Temple of Set Studies, Left-Hand Path Philosophy

central_thesis: The "Scroll of Set" explores the diverse facets of individual initiation within the Temple of Set's Left-Hand Path philosophy, emphasizing Xeper (self-creation and becoming) through conscious self-transformation, critical engagement with magical traditions, and community interaction, while providing practical guidance and philosophical depth for its adherents.

structure_content.summary: Conclaves and travel are essential for Xeper, fostering interaction, learning, and sensing the "Black Flame" face-to-face, transforming mundane travel into a liminal, sacred, and initiatory transition that strengthens the individual's sense of meaning and facilitates Remanifestation.

A personal account of initiation focused on self-invention, developing a unique magical style, and applying "Lesser Black Magic" for practical life changes, highlighting the interconnectedness of magical and mundane worlds in the pursuit of Xeper.

Xem is defined as a personal, subjective, and dynamic "secret confederation" of human and neter entities working for mutual Xeper. It is a state of "higher man" accessible through the "intelligence of the heart" rather than reason alone, requiring individual creation and regeneration.

This article explores the Grail Quest in Setian terms, equating the "chalice/Agathon" with changeable aspects of self (desire) and the "elixir/Daimon" with the unchangeable essential self (inspiration), with Runa as the ultimate telos. Achieving balance between these elements is crucial for initiation.

A detailed examination of Sethian Gnosticism, highlighting Seth as a celestial power/savior who provides gnosis (secret knowledge) for self-deification. It explains the Gnostic cosmology, the role of the Demiurge and Archons, and the magical practices for ascension beyond material limitations.

This article interprets Tantra and Kundalini as Left-Hand Path practices for self-deification, involving the awakening of the "feminine daemonic" and the burning away of delusions. It emphasizes the timeless nature of these practices and their practical application in Setian initiation, challenging Setian taboos on erotic magic.

This section addresses communication on e-mail lists, advocating for thoughtful discourse over reactive responses. It introduces "Virtues" (magical curiosity, quantifiable pride, humor, openness, moderation, synthesis, cunning) and "Vices" (narcissism, hubris, despair, emotional servitude) as essential guides for Setian initiation and self-mastery.

A critical, evidence-based debunking of the self-created myths surrounding Anton LaVey. It contrasts his legendary claims with documented reality regarding his personal life, origins, and the founding of the Church of Satan, providing objective historical context for a significant figure in modern Left-Hand Path history.

key_concepts.definition: The core principle of self-creation, becoming, and continuous evolution of the individual within the Temple of Set, leading to greater being and self-mastery.
The process of bringing what has been learned, realized, or created in one's inner being into new, manifest form in the external world, thereby enhancing existence.

A magical and spiritual philosophy focused on individual will, self-deification, and transcending conventional morality, as opposed to Right-Hand Path's focus on union with a higher power or external deity.

A subjective, personal realm or state of 'higher man,' understood as a 'secret confederation' of conscious entities (human and neter) working for mutual Xeper. It is accessed via the 'intelligence of the heart' and must be individually created and regenerated.
The 'ever-receding mystery' or 'eternal unknown' that serves as the ultimate telos and impetus for continuous Xeper and striving, always just beyond reach but driving onward movement.
The practical application of magical principles to mundane life situations, such as influencing relationships, achieving personal goals, or consciously changing one's own behavior and reactions.

In the Setian context, an internal 'fiery force' and the 'awakening of a feminine daemonic' that burns delusions and neuroses, leading to self-deification. It is a timeless experience beyond cultural restrictions.

A Left-Hand Path approach to self-deification, often involving symbolic uses of five elements ('5 m's': meat, fish, alcohol, parched grain, sexual congress) for initiatory purposes, distinct from exotic interpretations.
Represents the changeable aspects of the self, related to desire and what can be shaped and perfected through individual effort in initiation.
Represents the permanent, unchangeable, essential self, the 'secret center' or true self, which must be uncovered rather than created.

An ancient tradition, reinterpreted by the Temple of Set, emphasizing gnosis (secret knowledge) for self-deification and ascension beyond material limitations, with Seth as a celestial guide and savior.
A term used within the Temple of Set, associated with the unique divine spark or self-consciousness within each individual, guiding their Xeper.

practical_system.description: The Temple of Set's practical system is centered on Xeper, the individual's process of self-creation, becoming, and conscious evolution, guided by the Black Flame. It involves a continuous, conscious effort to develop one's unique being, challenge limitations, and integrate diverse magical and philosophical insights from various traditions. This is achieved through self-study, active participation in the Temple's community (conclaves, pylons), disciplined application of 'Lesser Black Magic' in daily life, and the pursuit of specific initiatory work tailored to individual needs and goals, such as exploring Xem, Runa, Sethian Gnosticism, or Tantric/Kundalini practices. The system encourages independent thought, critical analysis, and the synthesis of knowledge from both occult and mundane experiences.
tools: Magical diary (for integrating operations and self-reflection)
'Intelligence of the heart' (intuition, desire, and emotional understanding)
Active discourse and dialogue with other Initiates
Networking within the Temple and wider community
Understanding and applying 'Virtues of Initiation' (e.g., cunning, openness, moderation, magical curiosity)
Avoiding 'Vices of Initiation' (e.g., narcissism, hubris, despair, emotional servitude)
Study of diverse magical traditions and philosophies
rituals: Conclaves (collective initiatory and cultural interaction for shared Xeper)
Individual ritual workings for achieving a willed state of 'flow'
'Lesser Black Magic' for behavioral and situational influence in mundane life
'Ladder of Horus and Set' spell for ascension and Xeper (symbolic of central column of self)
Sethian Gnostic practices for gnosis and self-deification (overcoming material limitations)
Tantric/Kundalini exercises for awakening inner energies and self-deification

relevant_quotes.text: Lady Lilith created the tool called conclave that we use to create our culture.
The true power you will ever have is the power you invent; the most powerful magic you will ever use is the magic you create for yourself.

Set is known as the lord of foreign lands. He is a wanderer who crosses familiar borders into unknown territory. The Setian who consciously integrates this dimension of the Prince of Darkness into initiation transforms mundane travel into a forceful means of Xeper and Remanifestation.
The LHP Initiate knows that he doesn't follow his emotions, but that his emotions follow him.
To Xeper ir Xem is to make it anew, to create it for yourself. Xem is always present, yet regenerated each time a new intelligence claims it for itself.

The Temple understands the importance of true individuality, both in the mundane and the magical sense. Under the auspices of Set, one can be a real denizen of Xem because the Word of Set is Xeper. To enter Xem as a true individual, one must Come Into Being as a true individual, not as a sheep in a flock.

critical_analysis.relevance: The "Scroll of Set" serves as a foundational and evolving internal publication for the Temple of Set, providing deep insights into its philosophy, practical applications of Xeper, and community discourse. It critically examines historical occult figures (e.g., Anton LaVey), offers theoretical and practical guidance for personal initiation, and showcases the diverse approaches to self-creation within the order. Its content is crucial for understanding the intellectual and operational landscape of this specific Left-Hand Path organization.
critical_analysis.target_audience: Primarily current and prospective Initiates of the Temple of Set, seeking to deepen their understanding of Setian philosophy, practical magic, and community dynamics. It also caters to academic researchers and practitioners interested in modern Western Esotericism and Left-Hand Path traditions due to its detailed expositions, critical historical analyses, and documentation of internal practices and concepts.
